text:
Extremely beautiful park in a landed district area that has all your needs in one place and largely cater to the Seletar Hills small population.

The park isn‚Äôt big but it definitely has all the essential facilities and amenities from 3G fitness corner, to community garden, a children‚Äôs playground, basketball court and even old IPPT stations. There are swings available as well.

Plenty of benches are available for you to sit, rest, chill and enjoy nature.

One round on the footpath track is 290m long.

There are bicycle stations for you to park your bicycle as well.

There are a few restaurants and a coffee shop just beside the park so you could grab a quick meal there.

This place may be a little crowded during evenings.

Nice playground with a adequately maintain footpath ring that you can do some running/walking around. There are meter marks (also known as mile stones) painted on the footpath - incase you want to track the distance of your walking laps. There is an active food strip adjacent to the park.

Quiet park with good views. Seems popular with dog owners too as you can see many cute dogs here! I like that there are many benches which are well shaded. The small garden in the middle is beautiful and has a variety of plants. Very nice place to be.
Quite a big park. It is the size of one block of commercial building long. Saw few people playing basketball üèÄ in the afternoon. It was a hot day.

Childhood play area since P1, still go almost everyday at sec2, many friends there and we play basketball/football everyday and used to play catching too. I've prolly made 50 friends there over the years üòÇüòÇ
